name: conversions_check
description: Any conversions set up in tools>conversions?
long_description: If you are not measuring conversions, your spend is completely blind. This is a BIG red flag.

name: broad_modifiers_check
long_description: Broad match = printing money for Google, who make it way, way too broad and irrelevant.

name: short_modifiers_check
long_description: Similar to broad match issues, 1 and 2 work broad match modifiers are a flag to be investigated.

name: mobile_firendly_pages
long_description: Most internet browsing is now on mobile, so mobile friendly landing pages are mandatory.

name: landing_home_pages
description: Landing Page = homepage (no /anything at end of URL)
long_description: Home pages tend to be general - specific keyword-related pages are usually optimum.

name: low_quality_keywords
long_description: Low quality score = much higher CPCs compared to your competitors.

name: has_negatives
long_description: Negatives are keyword matches you do NOT want. If negatives don't exist, it indicates waste.

name: account_url_template
long_description: If a pro is working on your account, you will have account templates for superior tracking and/or fraud detection.

name: has_more3_ads
description: Ad groups have three or more ads
long_description: Always be beating your own ad copy.

name: search_ctr
long_description: Any search campaign <3% CTR is a red flag and needs priority investigation.

name: ave_position
description: Search Top Impression rate is Better than 30%
long_description: There is a lot of wasted opportunity going on, you are losing the battles.

name: have_trials
description: High spending account has experiments happening
long_description: Any decent-volume account should be experimenting. For example, with alternative bid strategies.

name: has_modifiers
description: CPC campaigns have bid modifiers in place
long_description: If manually bidding with CPC, bid-modifiers based on conversion maths should be in place or the setup is suboptimal.

name: has_customizers
long_description: If you're not using customized feeds, your ads aren't as personalised as they could be.

name: bid_strategy
description: Account has non manual strategies (applicable for spending over 3K)
long_description: Any decent-spending account should be trying 'smart' bidding strategies. They don't always work, but should be regularly tested.

name: has_customizers
long_description: DMYTRO - COPY OF ROW 15

name: location_interested
description: Location targeting set to "physically in" location, not "interested in" default
long_description: NOT APPLICABLE ANY MORE I DON'T THINK?

name: extensions_in_use
long_description: Extensions make your ad bigger - more ad real estate = better CTRs

name: channel_type_list
description: Display + Video + Shopping - which are set up/had traffic

name: top_placements
long_description: These are where your ads are showing most. Watch out for children's TV & VPN apps (if not relevant to your service) - these are typically waste

name: ctr15_placements
long_description: These placements are at best forced click placements, and very possibly fraud. Scrutinise any conversions here closely

name: cr15_placements
description: Placements with 15%+ Conversion (probably not real conversions)
long_description: If it looks too good to be true, it usually is. Track this placement through to sale and see if they are dodgy looking signups!

name: display_ks_targeting
long_description: On GDN, all targeting options have their merits and drawbacks. This tells you where you might be missing out.

name: display_topics_targeting
long_description: On GDN, all targeting options have their merits and drawbacks. This tells you where you might be missing out.

name: display_audience_targeting
long_description: On GDN, all targeting options have their merits and drawbacks. This tells you where you might be missing out.

name: display_placement_targeting
long_description: On GDN, all targeting options have their merits and drawbacks. This tells you where you might be missing out.
